info.name: Spaaza official API examples
info.description:
A set of example API calls for the Spaaza API using admin and end-user authentication. See the notes accompanying the individual requests and the following resources:

- [Spaaza API documentation](https://docs.spaaza.com)
- [Spaaza API authentication](https://docs.spaaza.com/#authentication)
- [Spaaza website](https://www.spaaza.com)

request.description:
Login to the Spaaza API as an admin user. See the following Spaaza documentation:

*   [User Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/users.html)
*   [Authentication](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/authentication/)
*   [Logging users in](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/login/)
    

Note the "Tests" section of this POSTMAN request uses the values in the response to a successful request to populate the "session_user_id" and "session_key" variables in the POSTMAN environment. These are then used to authenticate calls to other Spaaza API endpoints.

header.description: This header should be set if the client is an end-user, and not set if the client is an admin user.
The user ID of the API client user - this is shown in the response to the login.json endpoint
The session key for the logged-in API client user

request.description:
In Spaaza terminology, a “business” is a branch of a retailer (a “chain”). This API call updates an existing business. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Business Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/businesses.html)
*   [Altering a business](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/alter-business/)

header.description: The user ID of the admin user - this is shown in the response to the login endpoint
The session key for the logged-in admin user

urlencoded.description: Value populated from environment file. Can be overridden.

request.description:
Add a user to Spaaza using admin authentication. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [User Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/users.html)
*   [Adding a user](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/users.html)
    

Note the "Pre-request Script" section of this POSTMAN request is used to populate some of the values in the "Body" section of the request with their values. These can be overridden.

header.description: This header should be set if the client is an end-user, and not set if the client is an admin user.
The user ID of the API client user - this is shown in the response to the login.json endpoint
The session key for the logged-in API client user

urlencoded.description: Value populated from environment file. Can be overridden.

request.description:
Alter the details of a user account. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [User Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/users.html)
*   [Altering a user](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/alter-user/)

header.description: This header should be set if the client is an end-user, and not set if the client is an admin user.
The user ID of the user - this is shown in the response to the login.json endpoint
The session key for the logged-in user

request.description:
Delete a user for legal purposes. This API endpoint obfuscates all personally-idenfiable user details such as first name, last name, email address, gender, date of birth and address details. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [User Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/users.html)
*   [Deleting user accounts](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/delete-user/)

header.description: This header should be set if the client is an end-user, and not set if the client is an admin user.
The user ID of the API client user - this is shown in the response to the login.json endpoint
The session key for the logged-in API client user

request.description:
Alter the loyalty level of a user to that supplied. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [User Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/users.html)
*   [Campaigns Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/campaigns.html)
*   [Set loyalty level](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/alter-loyalty-level/)

header.description: The user ID of the admin user - this is shown in the response to the login endpoint
The session key for the logged-in admin user

urlencoded.value: Customer very happy with thier latest purchase.

request.description:
Add a note to a Spaaza end-user using admin authentication. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [User Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/users.html)
*   [User Notes](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/add-user-note/)

header.description: This header should be set if the client is an end-user, and not set if the client is an admin user.
The user ID of the user - this is shown in the response to the login.json endpoint
The session key for the logged-in user

request.description:
Delete a note added to a Spaaza end-user. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [User Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/users.html)
*   [User Notes](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/add-user-note/)

Log in as an end-user in Spaaza. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [User Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/users.html)
*   [Authentication](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/authentication/)
*   [Logging users in](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/login/)
    

Note the "Tests" section of this POSTMAN request uses the values in the response to a successful request to populate the "session_user_id" and "session_key" variables in the POSTMAN environment. These are then used to authenticate calls to other Spaaza API endpoints.

Get a token to do cross site authentication with the given app. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [User Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/users.html)
*   [Authentication](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/authentication/)
*   [Cross site authentication token](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/cross-site-authentication-tokens/)

Get a token to do cross site authentication with the given app. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [User Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/users.html)
*   [Authentication](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/authentication/)
*   [Cross site authentication token](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/cross-site-authentication-tokens/)

header.description: This header should be set if the client is an end-user, and not set if the client is an admin user.
The session key for the logged-in user
The user ID of the user - this is shown in the response to the login.json endpoint

request.description:
Check whether there is a valid Spaaza session for the supplied user and session key. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [User Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/users.html)
*   [Authentication](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/authentication/)
*   [Logging users in](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/login/)
*   [Getting user session status](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/get-session-status/)

header.description: The user ID of the user - this is shown in the response to the login.json endpoint
The session key for the logged-in user

request.description:
Destroy a logged-in session for a Spaaza API user, effectively logging the user out. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [User Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/users.html)
*   [Authentication](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/authentication/)
*   [Logging users in](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/login/)
*   [Logging users out](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/logout/)

header.description: This header should be set if the client is an end-user, and not set if the client is an admin user.
The session key for the logged-in user
The user ID of the user - this is shown in the response to the login.json endpoint
Accept a particular language or prioritised list of languages in the response

request.description:
Get the card for an individual end-user including all information about promotions, wallets, points and vouchers. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [User Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/users.html)
*   [Getting the "card" of a user](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/get-card/)

header.description: This header should be set if the client is an end-user, and not set if the client is an admin user.

request.description:
Get all vouchers for a user. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [User Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/users.html)
*   [Voucher Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/vouchers.html)
*   [Get all vouchers for a user](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/get-user-vouchers/)

header.description: This header should be set if the client is an end-user, and not set if the client is an admin user.
The user ID of the user - this is shown in the response to the login.json endpoint
The session key for the logged-in user

request.description:
Create a voucher in Spaaza. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Voucher Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/vouchers.html)
*   [Creating vouchers](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/create-voucher/)

header.description: This header should be set if the client is an end-user, and not set if the client is an admin user.

request.description:
Claim a voucher in Spaaza. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Voucher Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/vouchers.html)
*   [Claiming vouchers](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/claim-voucher/)

header.description: This header should be set if the client is an end-user, and not set if the client is an admin user.

request.description:
Unclaim a voucher in Spaaza. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Voucher Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/vouchers.html)
*   [Claiming vouchers](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/unclaim-voucher/)

header.description: This header should be set if the client is an end-user, and not set if the client is an admin user.

request.description:
Lock a voucher in Spaaza. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Voucher Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/vouchers.html)
*   [Locking vouchers](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/lock-voucher/)

header.description: This header should be set if the client is an end-user, and not set if the client is an admin user.

request.description:
Unlock a voucher in Spaaza. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Voucher Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/vouchers.html)
*   [Unlocking vouchers](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/unlock-voucher/)

Redeem a voucher in Spaaza. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Voucher Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/vouchers.html)
*   [Redeeming vouchers](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/redeem-voucher/)

header.description: This header should be set if the client is an end-user, and not set if the client is an admin user.

request.description:
Expire a voucher in Spaaza. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Voucher Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/vouchers.html)
*   [Expiring vouchers](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/expire-voucher/)

header.description: This header should be set if the client is an end-user, and not set if the client is an admin user.
The user ID of the user - this is shown in the response to the login.json endpoint
The session key for the logged-in user

request.description:
Delete a voucher. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Voucher Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/vouchers.html)
*   [Deleting vouchers](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/delete-voucher)
    

Note that, in the case of a voucher with a wallet campaign this will return the amount of the voucher to the customer's wallet balance.

Interact with a campaign in Spaaza. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Campaigns Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/campaigns.html)
*   [Campaign Interaction](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/interact-campaign/)

Get the number of referrals by a referring user as well as a partially obfuscated list of referred users.. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Campaigns Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/campaigns.html)
*   [Getting a user's referrals](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/get-campaign-referrals/)

header.description: This header should be set if the client is an end-user, and not set if the client is an admin user.
The user ID of the user - this is shown in the response to the login.json endpoint
The session key for the logged-in user

urlencoded.value: Manual addition of wallet amount - thanks!

request.description:
Adds a points or monetary wallet amount to the wallet of a specified user. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Wallet Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/wallets.html)
*   [Campaign Concept](https://docs-test01.spaaza.com/docs/api/campaigns.html)
*   [Adding wallet value](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/add-user-purchase-progress/)

Call to the Spaaza user-wallet-ledger endpoint to retrieve of a user's points or wallet history. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Campaigns Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/campaigns.html)
*   [Wallet Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/wallets.html)
*   [Wallet or points history](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/user-wallet-ledger/)

header.description: The user ID of the user - this is shown in the response to the login.json endpoint
The session key for the logged-in user

request.description:
Call to the Spaaza get-basket-price endpoint to request an adjusted basket (order/transaction). See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Basket Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/baskets.html)
*   [Get basket adjustments](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/get-basket-price/)

header.description: The user ID of the user - this is shown in the response to the login.json endpoint
The session key for the logged-in user

request.description:
Call to the Spaaza add-basket endpoint confirming a basket (order/transaction) and containing the minimum number of required values for a member transaction. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Basket Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/baskets.html)
*   [Adding a completed basket](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/add-basket/)
    

Note the parameters in the request JSON which should be edited to match the client's own details, such as customer member number.

header.description: The user ID of the user - this is shown in the response to the login.json endpoint
The session key for the logged-in user

request.description:
Call to the Spaaza add-basket endpoint confirming a basket (order/transaction), containing some optional parameters and including enough item article information to create a record in the Spaaza database which can be used for analytics purposes. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Basket Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/baskets.html)
*   [Adding a completed basket](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/add-basket/)
*   [Creating products and product variants through baskets](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/creating-products-with-add-basket/)
    

Note the parameters in the request JSON which should be edited to match the client's own details, such as customer member number.

header.description: The user ID of the user - this is shown in the response to the login.json endpoint
The session key for the logged-in user

request.description:
Call to the Spaaza add-basket endpoint confirming a basket (order/transaction), containing some optional parameters and redeeming a basket voucher. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Basket Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/baskets.html)
*   [Voucher Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/vouchers.html)
*   [Adding a completed basket](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/add-basket/)
    

Note the parameters in the request JSON which should be edited to match the client's own details, such as customer member number.

Call to the Spaaza add-basket endpoint confirming a basket (order/transaction), containing some optional parameters and returning a single item from a previous transaction. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Basket Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/baskets.html)
*   [Adding a completed basket](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/add-basket/)
*   [Processing a return inline](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/returns/)
    

Note the parameters in the request JSON which should be edited to match the client's own details, such as customer member number and return item details.

header.description: This header should be set if the client is an end-user, and not set if the client is an admin user.
The user ID of the user - this is shown in the response to the login.json endpoint
The session key for the logged-in user

urlencoded.description: Mandatory in the case of admin authentication, must not be passed in the case of user authentication.
One of `basket_id` `retailer_basket_code` or `supplementary_basket_code` must be used to identify the basket.
One of `basket_id` `retailer_basket_code` or `supplementary_basket_code` must be used to identify the basket.
One of `basket_id` `retailer_basket_code` or `supplementary_basket_code` must be used to identify the basket.
One of `user_id` `member_number` `username` or `authentication_point_identifier` must be used to identify the user claiming the basket
One of `user_id` `member_number` `username` or `authentication_point_identifier` must be used to identify the user claiming the basket
One of `user_id` `member_number` `username` or `authentication_point_identifier` must be used to identify the user claiming the basket
One of `user_id` `member_number` `username` or `authentication_point_identifier` must be used to identify the user claiming the basket

request.description:
Claim a basket in Spaaza. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Basket Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/baskets.html)
*   [Creating vouchers](https://docs.spaaza.com/api/create-voucher/)

Call to the Spaaza get-receipts endpoint to retrieve details of receipts for a brand or chain, matching various filters. Note that this API endpoint can also be used to export a CSV file of receipts. See the following documentation for more details on background and applicable parameters:

*   [Basket Concept](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/baskets.html)
*   [Receipt Object](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/receipt-object.html)
*   [Get All Receipts for a Chain](https://docs.spaaza.com/docs/api/get-receipts.html)
